archetype_name: Family Low-Carb Weeknight Bowls & Wraps (15–30, Mild)
name: Shawarma-Style Pork Lettuce Wraps with Cucumber-Tomato Salad
description: Quick skillet-seared shawarma pork tucked into crisp romaine leaves with a fresh lemony cucumber-tomato salad. Mild, low-carb, and weeknight simple.
prep_steps: Wash and dry romaine lettuce; separate large leaves for wraps.
Thinly slice pork chops into strips.
Dice cucumber and halve cherry tomatoes.
In a bowl, combine shawarma paste, half the lemon juice, half the lemon zest, minced garlic, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper; add pork and toss to coat.
In a second bowl, mix cucumber, cherry tomatoes, remaining lemon juice and zest, 1 tsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and parsley.
cook_steps: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tsp olive oil, then the sliced onions; cook 3–4 minutes until softened and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add marinated pork to the hot skillet in a single layer. Sear 4–6 minutes, stirring once or twice, until cooked through and lightly caramelized.
Return onions to the skillet, toss with pork, and adjust salt and black pepper to taste.
Assemble wraps: place pork and onions into romaine leaves and top with the cucumber-tomato salad.
